DelayNode.summary: The DelayNode interface represents a delay-line; an audio-processing module that causes a delay between the arrival of an input data and its propagation to the output.

remarks.para: A DelayNode always has exactly one input and one output, both with the same amount of channels.

para.see: The DelayNode acts as a delay-line, here with a value of 1s.

remarks.para: When creating a graph that has a cycle, it is mandatory to have at least one DelayNode in the cycle, or the nodes taking part in the cycle will be muted.

DelayNodeDelayNode.summary:
The DelayNode()
constructor of the Web Audio API
creates a new object with a delay-line; an AudioNode
audio-processing module that causes a delay between the arrival of an input data, and
its propagation to the output.

DelayNodeDelayTime.summary: The delayTime property of the interface is an a-rate representing the amount of delay to apply.

remarks.para: delayTime is expressed in seconds, its minimal value is 0, and its maximum value is defined by the maxDelayTime argument of the method that created it.

blockquote.para: Though the returned is read-only, the value it represents is not.
